question: Create an object called student and add 3 properties with their values.

Write a function named assignGrade, that takes one argument, a number score. Return a grade for the score, either “A,” “B,” “C,” “D,” or “F.” Invoke that function for a few different scores and log the result to make sure it works.
Create a function that takes an array of numbers and returns a new array with the square of each number.
Create a function which returns the number of true values there are in an array. const testArray = [true, false, false, true, false, false, false, true, true, true, false].
Declare variables called 'country', 'continent', and 'population' and assign their values according to your own country (population in millions). Log the result to the console.
Write a function that adds two numbers together.

Write a function that takes in an array of numbers as a parameter and uses the .forEach() method to double the value of all even numbers in the array. The function should not use any other loops or array methods.
Write a function that takes your age in years and returns your age in minutes.
Should “15” === 15, return true or false

Create a folder named “homework” inside the “boca-code” folder you created in class. Move into that folder. Inside of the “homework” folder, create a file named “variables.js” and do the remaining exercises inside the file.
Using Firestore, create a collection of your favorite childhood toys/games (at least 5).
Create a SQL table with your favorite dishes and cuisines.
Create a function that takes in a number of two-pointers and three-pointers made and returns a basketball team’s total score. Console.log the results.

Create a table of 3 of your favorite television shows, including the name of the show, favorite actor/actress, where it plays (netflix, cable, etc.), and the genre. Run a query to print all of the show names.
Design a database (any) for a Pizza Company. Add at least 3 pizzas. Add at least 2 customers. Add at least 3 orders. Write code to connect to database, get all and console.table.
Create a table of your favorite actor/actress from each tv show chosen. Include his or her first name, last name tv show, and name of character played. Run a query to print the character names.
Create a variable with let or const and assign its value to a string. Make it one of your favorite things, whether’s that’s a car, a pet, a family member, a food, etc.
Create a function that removes the first element of the array below and adds “kiwi” to the end of the array.let favoriteFruits = [“mango”, “lychee”, “rambutan”, “papaya”]

Write a function findNeedle() that takes an array full of items but containing one item, 'needle'. After your function finds the needle, it should return a message (as a string) that says: 'found the needle at position ' plus the index it found the needle. Example(Input --> Output) -['hay', 'junk', 'hay', 'hay', 'moreJunk', 'needle', 'randomJunk'] --> 'found the needle at position 5'
Write a function that converts hours into seconds. Return the result.
Write a function that takes an array of numbers and returns the sum of all even numbers.
Create a function that converts a string to uppercase letters. Console.log the results.
Declare variables called ‘country’ and ‘continent’ and assign their values according to your own country. Log their values to the console.
Write a function called combineTwoArrays that takes in two arrays as arguments, and returns a single array that combines both.
Write a function that returns the square of a number.

Write a function that takes the array below and modifies its order as follows: let myDreamCars = [“Charger”, “Cayenne”, “Cyber Truck”, “G Wagon”, “Civic)]. Remove the first element, add your dream car as the new first element, remove the last element, and add your first car as the new last element.

Create a folder named “homework” inside the “boca-code” folder you created in class. Move into that folder. Inside of the “homework” folder, create a file named “variables.js” and do the remaining exercises inside the file.

You are given 2 arrays, one called shoppingList and one called cart. Example: let shoppingList = [‘beer’, ‘milk’, ‘wine’] let cart = [‘milk’]. Create a new version of shoppingList where the items in the cart have been removed

Write a function that prints (console.log) the numbers from 1 to 100. But log “Fizz” instead of the number if it is divisible by 3, “Buzz” if the number is divisible by 5, and “FizzBuzz” if the number is divisible by both 3 and 5.
